author: Special Correspondent
text:
Accusing the Trinamool Congress government in West Bengal of “protecting criminals” Union Minister for Road Transport, Highways and Shipping Nitin Gadkari, along other senior BJP leaders, on Monday raked up the issue of Malda violence at a public rally in the adjoining Dakshin Dinjapur district.

“Who are those who set the police station on fire…why no action has been taken against them. Why those involved in poppy cultivation and fake currency are not punished,” Mr. Gadkari asked at the rally.

Addressing the rally at Buniyaadpur, the former BJP president alleged that Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee is engaging in “vote bank politics” with an eye on the upcoming Assembly polls.

Mr. Gadkari said that the BJP leaders were in the State to seek answers as to “why the culprits are spared by police and the honest citizens are being persecuted.”

“When you had taken the oath as the Chief Minister, you had sworn to protect the poor citizens of State. Now tell me, you are not protecting the poor citizens. Instead, you are protecting the criminals, hooligans, who are taking law in their hands who are looting and burning police stations,” he said. The Minister also said if BJP was voted to power in the State, it would take strong action against those indulging in criminal and illegal activities.

BJP national general secretary in-charge of West Bengal Kailash Vijayvargiya and observer Siddharth Nath Singh also said that action had not been taken against those involved in Kaliachak because of “vote bank politics.”
title: Mamata protecting Malda rioters: Gadkari
